discussion.content:
A is correct.

If communication is lost for five consecutive heartbeats between the witness host and the data sites, then the witness has failed. Virtual machines continue to run without interruption as the two data sites continue to have a qourum.

Selected Answer: A
The Role of vSAN Heartbeats - from VSAN STRETCHED CLUSTER GUIDE page 43-44
The vSAN Primary Node and the vSAN Backup Node send heartbeats every second. If communication is lost for 5 consecutive
heartbeats (5 seconds) between the primary node and the Backup due to an issue with the Backup node, the primary node
chooses a different ESXi host as a Backup on the remote site. This is repeated until all hosts on the remote site are checked. Ifthere is a complete site failure, the primary node selects a Backup node from the Preferred Site.
A similar scenario arises when the primary node has a failure.

I think A is correct.

non-preferred is isolated when any host on that site (backup node) is unable to communicate with master node in prefered site.

The vSAN Master Node and the vSAN Backup Node send heartbeats every second. If communication is lost for 5 consecutive heartbeats (5 seconds) between the Master and the Backup due to an issue with the Backup node, the Master chooses a different ESXi host as a Backup on the remote site. This is repeated until all hosts on the remote site are checked. If there is a complete site failure, the Master selects a Backup node from the Preferred Site.
A is the correct answer
I guess A is the right Answer.

questions.question_text: In a vSAN Stretched Cluster configuration, when is the non-preferred site determined to be isolated?

choices.A: When the master node is unable to communicate with any non-preferred site nodes
choices.C: When the backup node is unable to communicate with the preferred site
choices.D: When the master node is unable to communicate with the backup node
choices.B: When the nodes in the non-preferred site are unable to communicate with the vSAN Witness

choices.B: Reserving 8 vCPU and 32GB vRAM for controller VM

is correct

Data site to witness site Latency

Stretched cluster: ≤ 200 ms (for ≤ 10 + 10) ≤ 100 ms (for >10 + 10)
Two-node cluster: ≤ 500 ms

Taken from vSAN 6.7 Deploy and Manage Lecture Manual - Network Latency and Bandwidth Recommendations section

choices.D: 16-node vSAN cluster with nested fault domains
choices.A: vSAN stretched cluster with 4 nodes in each site

questions.question_text:
A vSAN Witness has connectivity to a vSAN cluster with supported maximum latency of 500 milliseconds round-trip time (RTT).
Which vSAN cluster type is the vSAN Witness a member of?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D for sure
D is correct

D is correct.

Network = Data site to witness site
Traffic Type = Layer 3, unicast

Taken from vSAN 6.7 Deploy and Manage Lecture Manual - Network Latency and Bandwidth Recommendations section
Answer is correct. https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/com.vmware.vsphere.vsan-planning.doc/GUID-39E2C6A6-0D7B-4708-BF64-DF5D4107B609.html

questions.question_text: Which type of encryption is used for the data encryption key on the vSAN datastore?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Is C is good
C for sure

C is correct.

When vSAN encryption is enabled, encryption is performed using an XTS AES 256 cipher in both the cache and capacity tiers of the vSAN datastore.

Taken from vSAN 6.7 Deploy and Manage Leture Manual - vSAN Encryption section

Correct C:, you can check more information how the encryption works
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/com.vmware.vsphere.virtualsan.doc/GUID-37F9636A-7481-4486-AAA9-E0A1A49343A1.html
